title: Vandalism
description: Pam tries to find out who vandalized her mural, Darryl finds out that Jim is a slob, and Oscar and Kevin go to Angela and The Senator's child's first birthday party.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Have you seen Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's around here somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mmm. [exits, Erin smiles deviously]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, Darryl's here. So is Santa Claus. It's just a regular Thursday. [checks for anyone around] Neither guy is here. And, it's Friday. Welcome to me and Darryl's world of lies.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nobody knows it yet, but Darryl already started working in Philly. So now, he has to sneak out of here like the sneakiest little sneaky-sneak you ever saw. And I'm his helper. It's so fun.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [as Darryl descends stairs, Erin ascends carrying a giant teddy bear] Darryl. Meet... bear... ull.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: How much did you pay for that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nothing. Won him at the carnival. Spent a ton on tickets, though. Drive safe.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Everybody knows I go to Philly. I've just been using sick days I saved up. But, Erin was so excited about being sneaky-sneaks, I went along with it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [exiting Darryl's office] Ha, ha, ha! Darryl, you are too much! [to Phyllis] That guy's hilarious. He's here today. [giant teddy bear is viewed in Darryl's office]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I've really been putting in the hours on this mural. And my boss is totally OK with it, because he's in the Bahamas and has no clue what anybody is doing. I'm usually very self-critical. I hate what I paint. But, I don't know, this time I feel like it's, um, it's really coming together... [sees mural] Oh my god! [camera pans to mural with butts painted over it] Wha? You've gotta be kidding me! What it... are those... are those butts? [to warehouse crew] Huh? No way. No way!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Excuse me, everyone. Is it OK if I leave early from work today? It's Phillip's first birthday and the senator and I are hosting a party at our house.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Aw, cute! So there'll be a bunch of kids.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. No children. Our house is not kid-friendly. Most of our furniture is sharp. Also, ew. It will mostly be campaign donors.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Angela, I am prepared to donate a whopping... [pulls cash from wallet] 8 dollars to Lipton For America to have an invitation...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, no, please. You know, actually, none of you could even really make the cut for this thing. Which I am so sad about.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [undertone] Angela. You're going to find out, so I thought I'd let you know that, uh, Robert invited me too.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He said he wanted me there for support.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm his! His... wife.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela's husband and I are in love. But, as a politician in this town, you still need the conventional blonde wife on your lawn signs. He is risking everything to have me there today. [laughs] Me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [on phone with Robert] We agreed that you wouldn't be seen with him in public. It's humiliating for me. Well, if you get to bring a stud, maybe I do too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [in Darryl and Jim's Philly apartment] Hey.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We are splitting a sublet on a place near Philly.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Just a couple of grown, sexy-ass roommates.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And, as much as I miss Pam and the kids, it's, uh, kinda nice to live the bachelor life again. You know, let your hair down.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Jim was nice enough to give me his bedroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm couching it!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Which usually means there's clothes all over the living room.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And this dude labels his food. He's the clean one. And, I'm the messy one. How much fun is this?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I love Jim. I love that he hooked me up with a job. It's just, he uses old t-shirts as wash rags. He doesn't wash his dishes. Apparently, they need to [quote-unquote fingers] soak... He hooked me up with a job.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [ascends on lift, using megaphone] Attention, everyone. Can I have your attention, please? Yeah, I don't know everybody's name down here, but whoever did this will you please raise your hand. [no one replies] Hello? This is not over. OK? I will stay up here all day if I have to. Is that what you want? [descends on lift] Yeah, I will also come down if I want to. It's my choice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't demand justice often. I'm not like Angela, who calls a lawyer every time someone watches a YouTube video of animals doing it. But, someone should get fired over this, right? Val's no help. Andy's gone. Jim's out. I just feel like I'm on my own here. [boom microphone bumps her head, she smiles] I mean, OK, not completely on my own. But, in terms of people who can do something. Thank you, Brian.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. So, Wade wants to send people to the Sloan conference. We gotta compile a list of our target clients.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Already on it. I ordered them by their Google trend ranking so we know who to hit first.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to camera] Who is this guy? We are killing it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes sir. [notices Jim's using his coffee mug]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [entering office] Conference room. Everybody. Now!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't have the clearance to call a conference room meeting.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, but David Wallace does. And he asked me to gather everyone to talk about stuff... That's gonna be revealed once we're in the conference room for the meeting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're telling me, David Wallace asked you to call a super secret, classified conference room meeting?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's go everyone. Super secret, classified conference room meeting, now!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to everyone in conference room] I have terrible news. Someone defaced my mural. They painted all over it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I thought that's what you were doing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but this is different.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. They used worse paint than your paint?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think so, but they put paint where I didn't want paint. So...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I thought you wanted paint on the whole thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Different colored paint. I wanted different colored paint in the spots where they put their paint. So, it just is... OK, the point is, these warehouse guys are vandals. And, they need to be stopped.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, and somebody had the balls to put my phone number on the men's room wall. Which is so messed up. It's 6782 not 83.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Uh, 6783's also a good time. Less mileage.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam, what can be done?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. Thank you. Let's answer that question.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was politely saying nothing can be done. I thought I was clear.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? Come on guys. We need to figure out who did this and punish them. This isn't just about me. This is about all of us. This is our mural. Don't you see? How much we worked on this? How much time and energy? We put our heart and soul into this thing.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: David Wallace called this meeting?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure did. I was as surprised as you, but apparently, he is very passionate about public art.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [as everyone begin to leave] No, no. Come on, guys. Don't go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pam, I'll help you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You will?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If there's anything I hate worse than art, it's crime.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I am in too, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes, of course. I believe in you. I believe in your art. And I am bored.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was hoping for a righteous mob, and I ended up with Dwight and Nellie. But, they both have a mob mentality. And, I'm pretty sure Dwight has a pitchfork in his car.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [enters quickly] You need my pitchfork?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [approaches Dwight as he leaves] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is it? I have vengeance to exact.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Exciting news. There's room for one more at my son's birthday event. And, I want you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah, I'm not interested.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What? Wait. The state transportation secretary will be there. You could sell your beet salt idea to the highway people.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If I get the deicing gig, it's not gonna be on merit. Not because I played politics. [exits]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey. So, a little birdie just told me that Dwight can't come to your son's birthday. So, do you want me to go with you?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: OK. I understand. I'll just stay here, then. Alone with the money.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Aw, crap.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [in warehouse] I am handing out pieces of paper. On which, you will draw one human butt. What I do with said drawings, is no one's business but my own.

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: You're gonna to compare 'um to the butts up there. [gestures mural]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Incorrect. It is my fetish. Oh, also, sign them. My fetish is signed drawings of butts.

quotes.speaker: Glenn
quotes.text: I'm not drawing a butt.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: All right then, they're bottoms. Uh, we should ask you to do big, rounded Ws.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. Or nipplous breasts. Perhaps.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: OK, OK. I think it's time to get back to work. Come on, fellas. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or melons. Like cantaloups. With the halves are cut off. And then, just the bottom parts...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, this is getting us nowhere.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We need another approach. Um, we need to fine the weakest one and separate him from the group. [they notice Nate struggling with a box] Yeah. I think if we could get Nate alone, we could crack him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We just need a pretense to talk to him. We could tell him that his mother is dying. That usually works on him. [holds up phone] Nate. Your mother is dying. [Nate reacts with grief]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: See, I feel bad about that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's all right. It's all right.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: So, she's gonna pull through again? [all nod] That's great. Can I talk to her?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. She needs her rest again.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Now listen. Now that we have got you here, let's talk about this mural business.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know who the vandal is. Now, I know a lot of these warehouse guys are your friends, but we've got chewing gum.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Gum's gotten mintier lately. Have you noticed? Like, some of it's just too minty. It's like they're literally trying to hurt...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [interrupting] Tell us who defaced the mural!

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [points at Warehouse Worker Frank] He did it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: All right. You can go. Give him his gum.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's no gum. There never was any gum.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: [leaving] That's really rude.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [at Phillip's party] Opening with pub pastries? That's a bold play. They're saying, it's only gonna get better from here? Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [noticing a portrait of Angela on the wall] That painting is just... How can anyone that weighs less than a guinea hen be so terrifying?

quotes.speaker: Party Announcer
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen, Senator and Angela Lipton. [guests applaud]

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Thanks, everybody. Thanks for coming. Phillip had no idea he was so popular.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [laughs] Oh, Robert, you're horrible. [to other guests] Simon, Maxine. [sarcastically] Who let you guys in here?

quotes.speaker: Athlead Employee
quotes.text: [points to Jim and Darryl] This is the team.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice job, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You too... Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [confused] What? [Darryl points at his thermos Jim has been using] Oh, man! I'm sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's cool. Reading's tricky sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, um... Are you really mad about this?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's my go-to thermos. That's all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. It's your go-to therm. Oh, man. That's a bummer. I'm sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No big deal. No big deal.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no. If it's a big deal, it's a big deal.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nah, nah...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No big deal.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [as Jim empties thermos into trash] Nah, nah, nah. You don't have to do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Honestly, I don't mind. [long, awkward pause until thermos is empty] Did you want me to wash it for you or...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I don't know. You gonna wash it? Or you gonna let it soak?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [after tense pause] OK. Here ya go. [roughly hands Darryl his thermos]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: So, Frank. Do you have any thoughts about what was done? By you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Nellie] Maybe, maybe I could, could get the ball rolling. [Nellie nods] Um, Frank? Hi. Pam. Um, I am so sorry if I've done anything to offend you. I'm sure it isn't easy for you guys to have an upstairs person coming down in your space. So. Truly. If, if, I apologize. But enough about me. Your turn.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [Warehouse Worker Frank remains silent, picks ear] You sort of deserve an apology here. Frank?

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: I'm sorry I didn't like your crappy doodles. I drew a butt. Big deal. Butts are funny.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I didn't think that butt was funny.

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: Well, maybe if you got the stick out of yours.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: You know what? You people can't fire me. So, screw you. [exits]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Whoa! Hey! That is not OK. What are you gonna do about that?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh... it... compliment...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: The first 'sorry' sounded sincere.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: There were two or three 'sorry's in there. [mumbles along with Nellie]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That sucked. He didn't apologize. There's no talking to that guy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, your little feelings party didn't work out? Huh? Who won the hugging contest? Oh, let me guess. Everyone tied for first.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We should just take him down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait. Are you saying...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm saying we should go scorched earth on that guy's face.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Normally, I find Pam to be a comforting, if unarousing, presence around the office. Like a well-watered fern. But, today, she has tapped into this vengeful, violent side. And I'm like, wow, Pam has kind of a good butt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He messed with something that was important to you. We need to mess with something that's important to him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A little eye for an eye action.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go all Hammurabi on this clown.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We need an infiltrator.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know just the man for the job. [looks at Clark]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Clark?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He even looks like a mole.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: One of his tee shots can wipe out a whole owl population.

quotes.speaker: Party Guest
quotes.text: You two seem very close.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Yes. We're good friends. Good friends.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: You know, I suppose that may ruffle a few feathers. For a long time, our party has turned it's back on the Hispanic people. Well, that is not who I am. [puts arms around Oscar] I am a friend of the Latino community. And if you ask me, it's time we bid bigotry hasta luego. [guests laugh] Now, does my embrace of Hispanics make me more electable? Given demographic trends? I don't know. And I don't care. What I care about is Oscar. [slaps Oscar's cheek] My friend. Mi amigo. Oscar. [guests applaud as he hugs Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Maybe I should be insulted that he only invited me here to be his token Mexican friend. But, he could of invited any number of Hispanics that he knows. His gardener, Rogelio. Or he could've invited... Rogelio. But, he chose me.  Rogelio's Malaysian... The son of a bitch is Malaysian.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I usually watch TV during my lunch breaks. It's cool?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Totally.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [after Darryl eyes him drinking from a thermos] It's mine. Don't worry.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I didn't say anything.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't think you had to.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think you might be going a little crazy with this labeling thing, man. I mean, you put your name on a five pound bag of flour. Are you honestly saying that if I needed flour I couldn't use that?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What you need flour for, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's not the point.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What? You making bread?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'm not making bread.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What kind of bread you making? Pumpernickel?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Darryl, it doesn't matter. I think you know the point I'm trying to make.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: All right, I'm being a jerk. You got me this job. I should be grateful. I am, I just... you know, I get finicky about my stuff. That's all.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's all good. Are we all good?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: We good.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What's that cooler?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Nothing. [pulls out a can of soda] It's mine. [Jim shakes his head] [after looking through DVR] What happened to my Tavis Smileys?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, crap. Were those yours?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [pulling Clark across the parking lot] I never want to see you working in the upstairs office again. Do you hear me?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, my only crime was loving the local sports teams and trying to be one of the guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Silence. You'll now be working in the warehouse with the untouchables. Now, go make your hands rough with work.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: OK, boss. [quietly] Pam, you know this is ridiculous, right? Like you're smarter than this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shh, shh.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: This is never gonna work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Shh. Remember your lines.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: What lines?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Go move some paper!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Darryl on phone] Hey, you know that guy Frank who works in the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: He's not my hire, but I know who he is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. What does he like? What's important to him? Does he have like a favorite pair of boots or a lunch box or...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What? Is he retiring? You getting him a gift or something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, something like that.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I know he loves his pick up truck.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, great! [to Dwight] His truck!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great. Get the plate number.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. [to Darryl] Do you know the plate... never mind. Why would you know that? And why would I be asking that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So we know which truck to van...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey. While I got you on the phone, your husband's like a sloppy, homeless hobo. Can you fix that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I was kinda hoping you could. I gotta go. Bye. [to Dwight] Come on. [camera pans to Clark duct taped to a chair]

quotes.speaker: Party Photographer
quotes.text: Hold on a second. Uh, Sandeep? Let's get you closer to the senator. Just about there. Great. And, Oscar? I'm gonna need you to step a little closer to the senator, as well. Somewhere there.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He's blocking me.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: It's only a photo, honey.

quotes.speaker: Party Photographer
quotes.text: [to party waiter] Excuse me, uh, what's your name?

quotes.speaker: Party Waiter
quotes.text: Sean.

quotes.speaker: Party Photographer
quotes.text: LaShawn. Great. You wanna be in a photo? Right this way. [notices overweight man following] Not you. No.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: He put me here.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He put you right in front of me?

quotes.speaker: Party Photographer
quotes.text: Let's just wheel Margaret right in front...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ow! Robert?!

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Angela.

quotes.speaker: Party Photographer
quotes.text: Smile. [Angela attempts to get in front of Oscar as pictures are taken]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm done. What are you... Is that supposed to be my mural?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. Frank draws a butt on your mural, I'm drawing your mural on Frank's truck's butt. Eye for an eye, mamacita.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aw, Dwight. That's really sweet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let's see yours.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no. Um, I, I'm embarrassed. It's stupid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is amazing! Frank! And he's leaving a trail of poops?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. And he has saggy boobs.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I saw that. That's great!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I feel better.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. I'm glad you feel better. This has been a wonderful day. I have to say, I like hanging out with a vengeful bitch.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know. You miss Angela, don't you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ugh! Don't sympathize. You're ruining the mood. Back to work. Draw his penis.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I got back at Frank in the most fitting way possible. With my art. The paints are water-based. It's gonna come off with a hose. But, I think the lesson will last a very...

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: [exiting building and approaching Pam] Lady! My truck? You had no right!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, you had no right!

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: It's a $40,000 truck!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So? You started it!

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: So? So someone need to shut you up! [attempts to attack Pam]

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey! [knocks Frank down with boom microphone]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: [as Frank gets up] Easy! [Frank grabs him]

quotes.speaker: Frank
quotes.text: You son of a bitch!

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: You're gonna hit a woman?

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Thanks so much for coming. Thanks so much. [to Oscar and Angela] Well. Have we all calmed down yet?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes. Sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It was all my fault.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: Let's all try to do better next time. Kevin, great to see you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. Thank you for the food. Oh, and also, you suck.

quotes.speaker: Senator Lipton
quotes.text: I beg your pardon.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You are like a terrible person. These guys care about you and you're just using them. Again, the food was very good. [Oscar and Angela exit looking pleased]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I'm gonna say something to the producers.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: No. No, it's...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You shouldn't be fired. I mean, you were just protecting me.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: It's all good. I knew what I was doing. It's... I'm sorry about your mural, though. I mean, because you put so much into that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Forget about my mural. It's stupid.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: No. You, you worked hard on that. That guy's an animal. I'm glad they're firing him too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's crazy. Brian, I'm so sorry.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Look. I don't, I don't wanna put myself where I don't belong. If you ever need me, you just call me. And I'll be there for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thanks, Brian.

quotes.speaker: Brian
quotes.text: Seeya.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. This whole Philly thing has been so much fun that I may have lost sight of what really matters. I mean, having fun is not nearly as important as being good to the people who you really care about. I mean, that's just 'Roommates 101'.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [playing video game with Jim] Oh. Come on!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh. Oh!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Damn!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [imitating game announcer] You win. [Darryl throws empty can on floor] How good did that feel?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That felt really good, actually.
